column4: does anyone know... is there the equivalent of a "make uninstall"?
I thought that just delets the objects from your source directory
not like /usr/local/  or wherever it installed to
I think make clean clears all objs in the local source folder so you can re-compile... but am not sure
I mean I suppose you could go through and figure out what directories the make install put things into, manually delete them, etc
oh interesting, sometimes the Makefile does specify an uninstall rule
by telling me if it does have the unistall parameter...  ;)
well in my case, for this source code, it must have, cause I tried it and it worked
I'll take your word for it then  ;)
furthermore... it looks like GNU Autoconf automatically makes the uninstall rule
